meanings.definition: The quality of being strong or powerful.
meanings.sent1: The valiances of the lion were evident as it roared loudly.
meanings.sent2: She admired the valiances of her favorite superhero.
meanings.sent3: The valiances of the toddler's tantrum were surprisingly strong.
meanings.sent4: The valiances of the storm shook the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The valiances of the volcano eruption were truly terrifying.

meanings.definition: The ability to produce effects or influence others.
meanings.sent1: His valiances in negotiations always led to successful deals.
meanings.sent2: The valiances of her words resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The valiances of the puppy's cute eyes made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The valiances of the rumor spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The valiances of the leader inspired the team to work harder.

meanings.definition: The degree of brightness or intensity of a light source.
meanings.sent1: The valiances of the sun at noon were blinding.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the valiances of the lamp to read comfortably.
meanings.sent3: The valiances of the fireflies lit up the night sky magically.
meanings.sent4: The valiances of the fireworks painted the sky with colors.
meanings.sent5: The valiances of the flashlight guided them through the dark cave.
